features: 【Multi-Function Smart Watch】: The Q9 PRO smartwatch fitness tracker can provide all-around body data tracking, .allowing you to accurately track 24-hour bady data and stress levels. Automatically monitor your sleep (Deep sleep, Light sleep, Awake time)to tell you how long you sleep during the night. sleep, Light sleep, Awake time)to tell you how long you sleep during the night.

【24 Sports Modes & 5 Atm Waterproof】: This fitness watch features 24 sports modes to check all-day activity data like steps, distance. Water-resistant up to 50 meters, you can wear the fitness tracker for swimming, and it will record your achievements even underwater.

【Smart Notifications】: Stay connected with calls, text, other app notifications, and convenient tools like timer, stopwatch, wrist sense, DND mode, find phone, sedentary reminder, music control, and weather display. Impressive 7-day battery life between a 2h flash charge, you can relax and enjoy more than a week of travel or work. The smart watch can stand by for up to 45 days when not in use.

【Smartwatches For Android IOS Phones】: The sports watch is compatible with iOS 8.0 and Android 4.4 and above devices. Download and install the Free APP, bind this smartwatch to your cell phone, and you can receive alerts of the SMS, incoming calls, and SNS.

【Personalized Custom Dial】: Immerse yourself in the 1.7" super-large and colorful HD display, and see all your incoming text and calls in expansive quality. Express more of yourself with 200+ watch faces and editable watch faces & widgets - or customize with your photos.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Tamispit Q9 PRO Fitness Smart Watch­­Exercise and Body check Are Always Under Your Control! 1.7 HD Full Color Large Touchscreen Screen Smart Watch for Android Phones and iPhone, support IOS 8.0+ and Android 4.4+. Basic Function: Clock, Date display, 200+ dials, Music Control, Stopwatch. Scan the QR code or search "GloryFit" to download. Daily Activity Monitoring: Sport data,temperature, sleep, step-counting, calorie, distance..etc Remind Function: Call reminder, short message notice, App reminder, Alarm reminder, Sedentary reminder. Sports Function: Q9 PRO sport watch has 24 exercise modes: Outdoor running, Cycling, Jump rope, Swimming, Badminton, Table tennis, Tennis, Mountain climbing, Walking, Basketball, Football, Baseball, Volleyball, Cricket, Rugby, Hockey, Dancing, Spinning, Yoga, Sit-ups, Indoor running, Gymnastics, Rowing, Jumping jacks.

Express More of Yourself Immerse yourself im the super-large and colorful HD display and express more of yourself with 200+ watch faces and editeble watch faces & widgets -or customize with your photos.

Call Reminder After connecting the phone to the smartwatch, you can see the incoming call alert and reject the call directly on the smart watch. More Features This O9 PRO smart watch also has convenient tools like a timer, stopwatch, wrist sense, DND mode, find phone, sedentary reminder, and weather. Camera Control Just open the App on your smart phone and find the shake camera function to take a photo by shaking your smartwatch.

Body temperature monitoring Adopting the newest chip and advanced body temperature sensors, smartphones can automatically monitor body temperature throughout the day. Inaddition to tracking real-time body temperature on thef itness watch, you can also visually check yourheart rate in the APP. 5 ATM Water-Resistance This smartwatch features upgraded waterproof nano-coating, which can prevent the sport watch against sweat, rain, and othelwater splashes, and help you to fully enjoy your exercise in all weather. Sleep Quality Monitoring Tamispit Q9 PRO fitness tracker watch can automatically track your sleep, large data analysis to detect sleep quality, deep sleep, light sleep, and awake time. Smart statistics thus letting you know your sleep quality.
The large screen and large battery capacity allow you to use the mens womens smart watches for a long time without stress.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great low-cost smart watch: recommended.
reviews.reviewText: Size and finish is similar to others, but functionality is better. Standard but comfortable band.Large number of screen formats to pick from- found one I really like near the end of the list!Battery life exceeds expectations at two weeks or more. Charger is great- watch clips into it so sure to resist bumps that might cause it to not charge.Description says good for swimming I've not tried it, but showering has been no problem. Haven't worn it into the steam room yet, that was the demise of my last choice (different brand).Heart rate, blood O2 look pretty accurate, but don't count on it for BP (no surprise).Sleep tracking seems a bit off, but OK for subjective "good" or "not good" night's sleep.Phone-side app is pretty basic, but does the job. I would love to see a feature that lets you download data to csv.Very good watch, would recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Solid watch for reasonable price. Could have more features but for the price, you can't go wrong
reviews.reviewText: The watch does everything you want it to do at a reasonable price. This is the new basic -- calculates steps, tells time, gives heart rate, has multiple options for face plates. It does everything fine but nothing great. For instance, the steps sometimes show up a 5-10 seconds late and then comes all at once, which has caused me to question whether the number is accurate. I've concluded from my non-scientific test that the steps are accurate there is just a delay occasionally. The App works fine but you need the app to do everything, like set time, which is why I only gave 4 stars. I should be able to set time on the watch. The battery is okay; not a long lasting Apple watch but this is about 1/10th the price. I call that a win!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Battery life is very long and the GloryFit app seemed decent, but is missing some key features
reviews.reviewText: The app worked pretty good. The body temp, heart rate, and BP seemed to work and detect with a +/- ~5-7% which is REALLY good for a watch of this quality. BP measured @ 124/62 which is probably a bit low for me, but not so far that I scratched my head and thought this thing is WAY off. The body temp was @ 96.2F and granted, I was in a room with an ambient temp of 62F and near an A/C unit that was on. After I moved away from it, it measured @ 98.2 which is perfect. The sleep tracker I could never get to work so I have no data to supply, and you can't just go to sleep when you want to test something like this. The steps tracking was not the key feature I bought a smart watch for, but it seemed to sit at ~5-7% +/-, which is not bad (for me, since I really do not care) but might be a bit too much for someone who is into fitness. The heart rate monitor was also spot on, sitting around 62-68 for me in a sitting position with no movement or stress level. Blood oxygen level had me @ 97%, and I really do not have a way to measure this otherwise...so we can assume it is within 1-2% of correct since I wasn't gasping for air or on the verge of passing out, or hyperventilating. The music controls worked, (play, pause, next song etc along with a small interface for EQ style) the messaging worked, (view only, there is no respond function) and there is a timer, stopwatch and a find function - all of which worked well.This is not an Apple watch, nor is it a Samsung watch. HOWEVER: For the price, this is a very capable smart watch that works with Android and iOS and will connect to your health APP on either. (Apple's "Health" app for me)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great beginner smart watch!
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to try out a smartwatch that won't drain my wallet so I gave this a try and it was the best decision I made. It tracks steps, calories burned, sleep, heart rate, blood oxygen levels, blood pressure, and temperature. The GloryFit app is great for keeping track of your health throughout the day and can be a good index for health improvement. It also has different sports profiles to train. Im a soccer player and the soccer profile tracks heart rate and calories burned while giving a graph of the moments your heart rate was at its highest and lowest. The running profile tracks your distance additionally. Overall, a great first smart watch.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars EDITED REVIEW: Good battery life Nice customization features for clock-faces
reviews.reviewText: First off, the price is great! I like the looks of the watch and the size of the watch face. Another reviewer mentioned that the watch comes in three separate pieces within the box and that's true -- the watch face and two watchbands. I put one of the sides of the band backward (not the one with the clasp). I never changed it back because it was not easy to move the spring mechanism to switch around, so I just left it as it was. I don't believe the step counter is really accurate. It's not a big deal for me because I have a step counter on my phone. The heart monitor seems pretty accurate. I like having it (I am a heart patient.) It is not sophisticated at all, but it is good to have to see the high and low ranges for the day. I barely use the app (it's called GloryFit). It probably has some cool bells and whistles that I won't use. In closing, I have had the watch for about a month. I have charged it three times. One time it didn't charge and I couldn't tell, so when I took the watch off the charger it had no battery life, so I couldn't use the watch that day. I wish the watch gave some type of low battery warning. EDIT it has a battery life indicator, you just need to choose the correct clock-face. It does not show the battery life on each clock face. The charge lasts about five days which is pretty good! All in all, I am happy with my purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great when it works
reviews.reviewText: Likes: display is well set up with everything easy to find. Has GPS built in. Measures temp, steps, heart rate, blood pressure, sleep etc.Dislikes: stops recording steps, sleep, everything until I restart it. Happens every other day or so. I usually don't realize it has stopped until halfway through a workout or in the morning when I look up sleep. The sleep monitor is not accurate. If I get up but am not excessively active (walking more than 1/4 mile non-stop), it will continue to record me was sleeping. Blood pressure always reads the same readings, which is wrong. Gps not all that accurate. I have a known length course I walk regularly, it measures it a different distance every time, few are accurate to the distance I have measured other ways.I purchased the watch mainly to track activity, which it does fairly well when it works. It's annoying when it records me as sleeping as I'm drinking coffee in the morning, but it's not a game changer
